revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins: Insights from Northwest African Margin and Magnetic Quiet Zone
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of passive continental margins, focusing on the northwest African margin and the magnetic quiet zone. The authors present results from seismic investigations and deep drilling, providing insights into the structure and geology of the region. They describe features such as the smooth acoustic basement, the Cretaceous carbonate front, and the existence of a 7.1 km/s layer at a depth of 14 km.
